articles.headline: Health Plan Overhauled at Wal-Mart
articles.snippet: The retailer unveiled a plan intended to expand coverage and offer workers cheap prescription drugs.
articles.abstract: The retailer unveiled a plan intended to expand coverage and offer workers cheap prescription drugs.
articles.lead_paragraph: Wal-Mart, long criticized for its health care coverage, unveiled a broad plan yesterday that is intended to cut employee costs, expand coverage and offer workers thousands of cheap prescription drugs.

articles.headline: Isolation of Gaza Chokes Off Trade
articles.snippet: With Gaza almost entirely shut off from normal trade, Palestinian businesses are enduring a deep depression.
articles.abstract: With Gaza almost entirely shut off from normal trade, Palestinian businesses are enduring a deep depression.
articles.lead_paragraph: KARNI CROSSING, Gaza — One man runs a large clothing business started by his mother. The other runs an illegal smuggling business started by his father. One deals in clothes, the other in weapons and explosives.

articles.headline: Fed Cuts Rate Half Point, and Markets Soar
articles.snippet: The Fed’s forceful move was intended to limit the damage from the disorder in the housing and credit markets.
articles.abstract: The Fed’s forceful move was intended to limit the damage from the disorder in the housing and credit markets.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 18 — The Federal Reserve rolled out its most powerful interest rate weapon on Tuesday in a bid to stop the turmoil in housing and financial markets from bringing down the overall economy.

articles.headline: Fed’s Move Helps Mood on the Street
articles.snippet: Nonetheless, economists and market specialists cautioned that the cut would take time to work through the system.
articles.abstract: Nonetheless, economists and market specialists cautioned that the cut would take time to work through the system.
articles.lead_paragraph: There was something for just about everyone in the Federal Reserve’s decision yesterday to cut its benchmark interest rate by half a point.

articles.headline: In Olympics Success, Romney Found New Edge
articles.snippet: A pragmatism that allowed Mitt Romney to run the 2002 Winter Games now haunts him.
articles.abstract: A pragmatism that allowed Mitt Romney to run the 2002 Winter Games now haunts him.
articles.lead_paragraph: SALT LAKE CITY — Mitt Romney walked onto the Olympic stage in 1999 a rich businessman still smarting from losing his first bid for public office. He walked off, three years later, a star-polished candidate who would be elected governor of Massachusetts in a matter of months. This was the place of his emergence and his transition.

articles.headline: New Push Into China by N.B.A.
articles.snippet: In a move certain to highlight the growing importance of China to both the National Basketball Association and the sport, the N.B.A. plans to announce Wednesday the formation of a Chinese subsidiary.
articles.abstract: In a move certain to highlight the growing importance of China to both the National Basketball Association and the sport, the N.B.A. plans to announce Wednesday the formation of a Chinese subsidiary.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG, Wednesday, Sept. 19 — In an age dominated by Chinese exports, one import from the United States has stood taller than most here: basketball.

articles.headline: An Old Friend Joins Giuliani in a Spotlight
articles.snippet: The ties run deep between Rudolph W. Giuliani and the attorney general nominee, Michael B. Mukasey.
articles.abstract: The ties run deep between Rudolph W. Giuliani and the attorney general nominee, Michael B. Mukasey.
articles.lead_paragraph: They were together early in their professional lives, as federal prosecutors working on corruption cases and later when they were engaged in private practice at the same firm, where they shared a fondness for practical jokes.

articles.headline: Future Look of Iraq Complicated by Internal Migration
articles.snippet: A vast ethnic and sectarian displacement, as revealed in new data, could make a partition of the country more difficult.
articles.abstract: A vast ethnic and sectarian displacement, as revealed in new data, could make a partition of the country more difficult.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD, Sept. 18 — A vast internal migration is radically reshaping Iraq’s ethnic and sectarian landscape, according to new data collected by thousands of relief workers, but displacement in the most populous and mixed areas is surprisingly complex, suggesting that partitioning the country into semiautonomous Sunni, Shiite and Kurdish enclaves would not be easy.
articles.byline: By James Glanz and Alissa J. Rubin

articles.headline: Will the Fed Reverse the Housing Slump?
articles.snippet: There are good reasons to believe that the real estate slump has a long way to go, and that’s the main reason the Fed went further than most analysts expected in cutting interest rates.
articles.abstract: There are good reasons to believe that the real estate slump has a long way to go, and that’s the main reason the Fed went further than most analysts expected in cutting interest rates.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Federal Reserve sent the stock market soaring yesterday. So can it stop the decline in home prices, too?

articles.headline: Suddenly, a Hesitation About Splurging
articles.snippet: Lavishness is being replaced by caution at hedge funds due to the recent turmoil in the markets and calls from Capitol Hill to increase taxes on the industry.
articles.abstract: Lavishness is being replaced by caution at hedge funds due to the recent turmoil in the markets and calls from Capitol Hill to increase taxes on the industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: On a sun-splashed day in Southampton this month, Harald Grant, a Sotheby’s real estate agent, showed his top listing for a hedge fund client.
